description: From Ancient Greek θεματικός (thematikós), from θέμα (théma, “theme”). Equivalent to theme +‎ -atic.

adjectives.description: thematic (comparative more thematic, superlative most thematic)

entries.meaning: Relating to, or having a theme (“subject”) or a topic.
examples: He had a thematic collection of postage stamps with flags on them (where (UK) thematic collection is equivalent to (US) topical collection)

entries.meaning: (linguistics) Of a word stem, ending in a vowel that appears in or otherwise influences the noun or verb's inflection.
(history) Of or relating to a theme (“subdivision of the Byzantine empire”).
A postage stamp that is part of a thematic collection.
